characters.story: "CHANGE!" the wild rice and water lily command sharply - use the scale for weighing, a balance!
"Yow?" the water questions curiously - to confuse, mix up the imp and monster!
"AYE!" the flowers command sharply - Chinese mugwort, an herb, wormwood!
"AI!" the mouth sings cheerfully - Good grief! An exclamation, alas!
"Bah?" the fingers question curiously - to pull out, extract, remove and yank!
"PAN!" the fingers and tree sing cheerfully - to climb, scale and ascend!
"Tune?" he questions curiously about where to stockpile, store and accumulate.
"DUN!" the head commands sharply - to pause, stop for a meal suddenly!
"DUN!" the mouth and pause command sharply - that's one ton, a weight measure!
"Churn?" the thread questions curiously - is it pure, unadulterated and genuine?
"JAY!" he commands sharply - the deadline to fall due, the session and term arrive!
The teeth bend down drooping to bite and pierce with molars.
"CHEW!" the teeth and sentence sing cheerfully - watch the shows, the performance and act!
"Ling?" the teeth question curiously about orders - what's the length of service, the age in years?
"SHYUNG!" the water sings cheerfully when bound up with sinister forces - turbulent, fierce and violent!
"Lee?" the bamboo questions curiously as it leaves - building a fence, a barrier and railing.
"GOO!" the sinner sings cheerfully despite the crime, guilt and offense.
The house and chili pepper bend down - time to butcher, slaughter and kill!
